Article.Abstract: Previous studies in murine and human models have suggested an important role for HLA Ia-restricted CD8(+) T cells in host defense to Mycobacterium tuberculosis (Mtb). Therefore, understanding the Ags presented via HLA-Ia will be important in understanding the host response to Mtb and in rational vaccine design. We have used monocyte-derived dendritic cells in a limiting dilution analysis to generate Mtb-specific CD8(+) T cells. Two HLA-Ia-restricted CD8(+) T cell clones derived by this method were selected for detailed analysis. One was HLA-B44 restricted, and the other was HLA-B14 restricted. Both were found to react with Mtb-infected, but not bacillus Calmette-Guérin-infected, targets. For both these clones, the Ag was identified as culture filtrate protein 10 (CFP10)/Mtb11, a 10.8-kDa protein not expressed by bacillus Calmette-Guérin. Both clones were inhibited by the anti-class I Ab and anti-HLA-B,C Abs. Using a panel of CFP10/Mtb11-derived 15-aa peptides overlapping by 11 aa, the region containing the epitopes for both clones has been defined. Minimal 10-aa epitopes were defined for both clones. CD8(+) effector cells specific for these two epitopes are present at high frequency in the circulating pool. Moreover, the CD8(+) T cell response to CFP10/Mtb11 can be largely accounted for by the two epitopes defined herein, suggesting that this is the immunodominant response for this purified protein derivative-positive donor. This study represents the first time CD8(+) T cells generated against Mtb-infected APC have been used to elucidate an Mtb-specific CD8(+) T cell Ag.
Article.ArticleTitle: Classically restricted human CD8+ T lymphocytes derived from Mycobacterium tuberculosis-infected cells: definition of antigenic specificity.
Article.Affiliations: Division of Pulmonary and Critical Care Medicine, Oregon Health Sciences University/Portland Veterans Affairs Medical Center, 97207, USA. lewinsod@ohsu.edu.
Article.ArticleChemicalList: Antibodies, Blocking;Antibodies, Monoclonal;Antigens, Bacterial;Bacterial Proteins;CFP-10 protein, Mycobacterium tuberculosis;Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte;HLA Antigens;Histocompatibility Antigens Class I;Tuberculin
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Amino Acid Sequence; Antibodies, Blocking(pharmacology); Antibodies, Monoclonal(pharmacology); Antigen Presentation; Antigens, Bacterial(blood; immunology; metabolism); Bacterial Proteins(blood; immunology; metabolism); CD8-Positive T-Lymphocytes(immunology; metabolism; microbiology); Clone Cells; Cytotoxicity Tests, Immunologic; Epitope Mapping; Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte(immunology; metabolism); HLA Antigens(immunology; metabolism); Histocompatibility Antigens Class I(immunology; metabolism); Humans; Jurkat Cells; Lymphocyte Count; Molecular Sequence Data; Mycobacterium tuberculosis(immunology); Tuberculin(blood)
Article.Comments: Data originally imported from the HLA Ligand Database (http://hlaligand.ouhsc.edu/)

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A healthy individual PPD+ (assumed to have been exposed to source species) was used as a source for CD8+ cells. CD8+ cell clones were obtained by in vitro stimulation with M. tuberculosis infected dendritic cells.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: A CD8+ T cell clone raised against the source species recognizes this epitope in a dose dependent manner. The use of a variety of 9-,10- and 11-mer peptides for loading monocyte-derived DCs allowed for the determination of this peptide as the minimal epitope. Also, peptide-pulsed Jurkat cells, transgenic for B44 (matching the donor at that single allele), are lysed effectively by this clone, allowing for the determination of B44 as the restricting allele.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A healthy individual PPD+ (assumed to have been exposed to source species) was used as a source for CD8+ and CD4+ cells, purified with magnetic microbeads.

MhcAllele.MhcEvidenceCode: T cell assay -Single MHC type present

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CD8+ T cells from a PPD+ healthy individual recognize this epitope preferentially in an ELISPOT assay, as compared to peptides spanning the entire source protein sequence, implying this is an immunodominant HLA-B44 restricted epitope. CD4+ T cells are also stimulated by this epitope, but to a lower extent.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A healthy individual PPD+ (assumed to have been exposed to source species) was used as a source for CD8+ cells. CD8+ cell clones were obtained by in vitro stimulation with M. tuberculosis infected dendritic cells.

MhcAllele.MhcEvidenceCode: T cell assay -Single MHC type present

AssayInformation.AssayComments: A CD8+ T cell clone raised against source species, previously shown to be peptide specific, recognized and lysed source species infected monocyte-derived dendritic cells.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A healthy individual PPD+ (assumed to have been exposed to source species) was used as a source for CD8+ and CD4+ cells, purified with magnetic microbeads.

MhcAllele.MhcEvidenceCode: T cell assay -Single MHC type present

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CD8+ T cells from a PPD+ healthy individual are shown to preferentially recognize monocyte-derived DCs loaded with peptides 81-95 and 85-100 containing this epitope and with the peptide 85-94 representing the minimal version of it, in comparison to DCs presenting peptides spanning the entire source protein sequence, implying this is an immunodominant HLA-B14 restricted epitope. CD4+ T-cells are only marginally reactive to this peptide.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A healthy individual PPD+ (assumed to have been exposed to source species) was used as a source for CD8+ cells. CD8+ cell clones were obtained by in vitro stimulation with M. tuberculosis infected dendritic cells.

MhcAllele.MhcEvidenceCode: T cell assay -Single MHC type present

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The use of a variety of 9-,10- and 11-mer peptides for loading monocyte-derived dendritic cells or autologous lymphoblastoid cells allowed for the determination of this peptide as the minimal epitope. Its restricting allele, B-14, was determined by using APC lines matching at a single allele (not shown).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CD8+ T cell clone raised against the source species, previously shown to be peptide specific, recognizes and lyses source species infected monocyte-derived dendritic cells.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CD4+ and CD8+ T cells from a PPD+ healthy individual preferentially recognize this epitope in an ELISPOT assay with peptide-pulsed monocyte-derived DCs.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A healthy individual PPD+ (assumed to have been exposed to source species) was used as a source for CD8+ and CD4+ cells, purified with magnetic microbeads.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: A healthy individual PPD+ (assumed to have been exposed to source species) was used as a source for CD8+ and CD4+ cells, purified with magnetic microbeads.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CD4+ and CD8+ T cells from a PPD+ healthy individual did not recognize this epitope in an ELISPOT assay.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Peptide shown not to be the recognized by CD4 or CD8 T cells purified from PBMCs of a PPD+ individual. Protein name stands for 10 kDa culture filtrate antigen, also known as ESAT-6 like protein.
